title: NATO ALPHABET
guide:
# The NATO Alphabet: How to Spell Like a Pilot

## 1. The Concept (ELI7)
Imagine you are talking to your friend on a walkie-talkie.
There is a lot of noise and static (*Shhh-crackle-pop*).
You say: "The code is **B**!"
Your friend hears: "Did you say **D**? Or **E**? Or **T**?"

Letters like B, C, D, E, G, P, T, V, Z rhyme and sound exactly the same over bad radios.
To fix this, soldiers and pilots created a rule: **Don't say the Letter. Say a specific Word.**

Instead of "B", say **"Bravo"**.
Instead of "D", say **"Delta"**.
Now, nobody gets confused. Even if the radio is bad, "Bravo" sounds totally different from "Delta".

---

## 2. The Complete Alphabet (A-Z)
This is the official list used by police, pilots, and soldiers all over the world.

| Letter | Code Word | Pronunciation (How to say it) |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **A** | **Alpha** | **AL**-fah |
| **B** | **Bravo** | **BRAH**-voh |
| **C** | **Charlie** | **CHAR**-lee (or SHAR-lee) |
| **D** | **Delta** | **DELL**-tah |
| **E** | **Echo** | **ECK**-oh |
| **F** | **Foxtrot** | **FOKS**-trot |
| **G** | **Golf** | **GOLF** |
| **H** | **Hotel** | hoh-**TELL** |
| **I** | **India** | **IN**-dee-ah |
| **J** | **Juliett** | **JEW**-lee-ett |
| **K** | **Kilo** | **KEY**-loh |
| **L** | **Lima** | **LEE**-mah |
| **M** | **Mike** | **MIKE** |
| **N** | **November** | no-**VEM**-ber |
| **O** | **Oscar** | **OSS**-cah |
| **P** | **Papa** | pah-**PAH** |
| **Q** | **Quebec** | keh-**BECK** |
| **R** | **Romeo** | **ROW**-me-oh |
| **S** | **Sierra** | see-**AIR**-rah |
| **T** | **Tango** | **TANG**-go |
| **U** | **Uniform** | **YOU**-nee-form |
| **V** | **Victor** | **VIK**-tah |
| **W** | **Whiskey** | **WISS**-key |
| **X** | **X-ray** | **ECKS**-ray |
| **Y** | **Yankee** | **YANG**-key |
| **Z** | **Zulu** | **ZOO**-loo |

---

## 3. The Numbers (0-9)
Even numbers can be confusing. "Five" sounds like "Nine".
So, we change the sound slightly to make them super clear.

| Number | Pronunciation | Why? |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **0** | **ZE-RO** | Standard. |
| **1** | **WUN** | Strong "W" sound. |
| **2** | **TOO** | Sharp "T". |
| **3** | **TREE** | No "Th". "Th" is soft and gets lost in static. |
| **4** | **FOW-er** | Two syllables to be clear. |
| **5** | **FIFE** | Hard "F" at the end. "Five" sounds like "Fire". |
| **6** | **SIX** | Standard. |
| **7** | **SEV-en** | Two syllables. |
| **8** | **AIT** | Standard. |
| **9** | **NIN-er** | Say "Niner" so it doesn't sound like "No". |
| **.** (Dot) | **DECIMAL** | For coordinates (e.g., One Decimal Five). |

---

## 4. How to Use It
If your name is **SAM**:
Don't say: "S as in Sam, A as in Apple..."
Say: "My name is **Sierra - Alpha - Mike**."

***
